label: 05. Novissima et Accuratissma Totius Americae Descriptio
description: In this map by Gerrit van Schagen (1642-1690) California is a large island, there is one Great Lake (Lac contenant), a large open lake in place of the western Great Lakes, and the conjectural Northwest Passage, with the Straits of Anian.  The elaborate title cartouche at the bottom left contains scenes of native Americans hunting, panning for gold and a chief standing beneath an umbrella.  Also, the map shows other small illustrations: a war being waged by Indians in South America and a figure lying in a hammock.  There is a large vignette at the top left of Neptune and his sons, the Tritons. 51 x 62cm.

Also, the map shows other small illustrations: a war being waged by Indians in South America and a figure lying in a hammock.  There is a large vignette at the top left of Neptune and his sons, the Tritons. 51 x 62cm.
